meanings.definition: The state of being able to read but choosing not to do so.
meanings.sent1: Her aliteracy prevented her from enjoying the new book.
meanings.sent2: His aliteracy led to him missing out on valuable information.
meanings.sent3: The cat's aliteracy was evident when it ignored the newspaper.
meanings.sent4: The garden's aliteracy towards the books was like a wall blocking knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The aliteracy of the students was a barrier to their academic success.

meanings.definition: The lack of interest or motivation to engage in reading.
meanings.sent1: The boy's aliteracy made him choose video games over books.
meanings.sent2: Her aliteracy was evident when she avoided the library.
meanings.sent3: The aliteracy of the dog was clear as it walked away from the book.
meanings.sent4: The aliteracy in the room was a heavy cloud dampening curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The aliteracy of the group hindered their ability to learn new things.

meanings.definition: The condition of being capable of reading but not actively participating in reading activities.
meanings.sent1: His aliteracy was surprising considering his excellent reading skills.
meanings.sent2: The aliteracy of the community was a concern for the library staff.
meanings.sent3: The aliteracy of the tree was amusing as it stood next to the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: The aliteracy in the air felt like a fog obscuring the joy of reading.
meanings.sent5: The aliteracy of the town was a challenge for the literacy program.
